Comparte una pizza con nosotros mientras discutimos sobre las mejores practicas en Android.

speaker: Adit Lal
title: BlrKotlin - Kotlin User Group
subject: The power of inline
description: This talk highlights the usages of Inline in Kotlin. How it works and how it helps increase code quality. This session will provide some details on experimental features like inline classes, the difference between inline, crossInline and noinline.

speaker: Adit Lal
title: BlrKotlin - Kotlin User Group
subject: Coroutines & Asynchronous Programming
description: This talk is targeted for audiences who are already a bit familiar or atleast had a short introduction to Kotlin Coroutines. We will dig deeper to various APIs of Coroutines and how to use them more efficiently. We will also explore experimental features of Kotlin coroutines - channels and the select API. Finally we will have a look how to use Coroutines with Rx with kotlinx-coroutines-rx2

speaker: Wojtek Kalicinski
title: Madrid Android Developer Group
subject: All for one and one for all. Kotlin Mutiplatform
description: The promise of cross-platform frameworks looks great on paper, and some of them do a pretty good job delivering actual results. But with inherent differences between platforms, is "build once, run anywhere" even worth pursuing? Learn how you can share parts of your app between mobile platforms (and even the web!) without compromising quality, and delivering a best in class Android experience. During this talk I'll explain the basics of setting up Kotlin Multiplatform projects, show an example app sharing business logic in Kotlin between Android, iOS and the web, and show how to implement your own Kotlin MP libraries.

speaker: Pavel Finkelstein
title: DevsDay.ru
subject: Kotlin в продакшн
description: На встрече Павел предлагает обсудить, как живётся котлину в энтерпрайзе большей или меньшей коварности. Он расскажет, на какие грабли успел наступить примерно за два года активной разработки, какие плюшки и удобности нашёл, и что его удивило.

speaker: Sébastien Deleuze
title: Sourcelabs B.V.
subject: Spring Boot with Kofu and Coroutines

speaker: Allard Buijze
title: Sourcelabs B.V.
subject: Bootiful CQRS and Event Sourcing with Axon

speaker: Chris Celiberti
title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: Corda / Blockchain
description: With Blockchain being all the rage these days right, wrong or indifferent companies are looking at this technology to create de-centralized products and services. StreetWire will present its real estate application built on Kotlin using R3's Corda open source platform exploring the workings of the blockchain, Corda's framework, Kotlin code and technical aspects of the application.

speaker: Talon Ghost
title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: Nimble Web Framework
description: Let's build a web app with Kotlin! In this talk I would like to share how Nimble makes it easy peasy to start building web applications that share the same data structures and logic as your backend Kotlin service! We will explore a small example that consumes data from the internet and renders content onto a page while investigating the simple API exposed by Nimble!

speaker: Andrey Mischenko
title: Singapore Kotlin User group
subject: Kotlin Part
description: This talk is about the current state of the Kotlin as a `tool` for multiplatform development for Android and iOS. The presented approach can be considered as a solution for the old problem of sharing code between platforms and might be interesting for both Android and iOS developers

speaker: Guy Heylens
title: Kotlin Belgium User Group
subject: Kotlin/Native: The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly
description: The promise of write-once-run-everywhere has haunted native mobile developers since the first time someone whispered the words “phone gap”. But what if there was a way to have cross-platform development with a modern, type-safe language? JetBrains is trying to make this happen with Kotlin/Native, which compiles to LLVM bytecode, and can run on iOS, Android, and even the web. Learn more about some of the benefits of working with Kotlin/Native, some of the drawbacks, and a few of the (current) potential dealbreakers when it comes to using this exciting new technology in a real app.

speaker: Paul Reilly
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Kotlin MPP in action on the Argus Project
description: Tonight, I will present a status update on the Argus project. We will focus on a Kotlin MPP support library used to provide data from The Movie DB (TMDB) visiting some Kotlin features used in the library (tmdb-lib at https://github.com/pajato/tmdb-lib), specifically parsing Json with Kotlin Serialization, accessing TMDB data sets using coroutines and testing using Ktor. The talk will be highly interactive as I seek out feedback and suggestions from the Kotlin gurus in attendance.

speaker: Michel Onwordi
title: Kotlin user group Berlin
subject: Type Assisted Development: A case for Inline Classes

speaker: Oleksii Fedorov
title: Kotlin user group Berlin
subject: How to Avoid False Sense of Null-safety?

speaker: Marie Katrine Ekeberg, Anders Mikkelsen
title: Oslo Kotlin Meetup
subject: Kotlin hack and learn - coroutines
description: Want to hack and learn coroutines with us? Coroutines is a popular topic these days when parallell and asynchronous programming is discussed. In this meetup we will take a look at coroutines, their differences to threads and how you can use it in your project. Instead of just a presentation, we will hack and learn together! Bring your laptop, we will provide pizza and tasks. To get you started we will even throw a short introductory presentation into the mix.

speaker: Gareth Fleming
title: Kotlin Belfast User Group
subject: The transition from Java to the wonderful world of Koltin

speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
title: Kotlin Belfast User Group
subject: Writing a fully-working game of Snake in less than an hour of pure Kotlin + IntelliJ

speaker: Dave Glover
title: Sydney Kotlin User Group
subject: Building an End-to-End Secure, Scalable IoT Serverless Solution
description: Learn how to build and run your IoT solutions securely and at scale. We will cover device security with Azure Sphere, distribute intelligence to the edge with Azure IoT Edge, and building real-time serverless solutions with Azure Functions and Azure SignalR

speaker: Dmytro Gorodnitskiy
title: Lviv Kotlin User Group
subject: Android navigation components: як не заблукати серед трьох сосен

speaker: Anna Shkabara
title: Kotlin Dnipro
subject: A short story about Android BLE

speaker: Marcin Moskała
title: Kotlin Night Warsaw
subject: Understanding Kotlin Coroutines
description:
Kotlin Coroutines is a powerful tool. Well implemented concept of suspendable computation... It is a dream of many theoretics of concurrent programming for a long time. But how it is possible? How do Kotlin coroutines really work? Why are they important? What do they introduce? And finally, how you can use them in your project?

In this talk, I will show you how to use Kotlin Coroutines and what makes them so special and so efficient. I will also discuss if they are an alternative to RxJava.

speaker: Arturo Mejia
title: Kotlin Toronto
subject: A gentle introduction to Kotlin Coroutines
description: In this talk, we're are going to introduce the concept of Kotlin Coroutines in an easy and simple way. We are going to talk about its core concepts, what's makes them special, how you can use and test them, and finally how they are different from other alternatives like Rx.

speaker: Yahor Berdnikov
title: Kotlin User Group Munich
subject: First stable release of CoRedux. What is change since previous talk and how it look now?

speaker: Ilya Chernikov
title: Kotlin User Group Munich
subject: Kotlin Scripting. Using Kotlin as a scripting language

speaker: Alfred Foltin
title: Kotlin.amsterdam
subject: Hacking with Kotlin
description: Have a Kotlin project you want to show? Just getting started with Kotlin and need some help? Interested in some Kotlin hacks? This evening is for you.

speaker: Akinrolie Shola Slick
title: Kotlin Ondo User Group
subject: Kotlin Webinar Ondo
description: Experience the power of the fastest growing language in the world. Learn mobile development with ease and get resources, tools, and latest updates on Kotlin and more.

speaker: Ryan Perkins
title: Chicago Kotlin Users Group
subject: Kotlin Multiplatform
description: This talk will discuss what multi-platform and native Kotlin is, how organizations and teams can utilize it in their projects, and the advantages and disadvantages of adopting it.

speaker: Falk Appel
title: Kotlin Karlsruhe User Group
subject: Build your own Kotlin Dependency Injection

speaker: Andrey Govorovsky
title: Apps Conf 2019
subject: Model Driven-конфигурация приложения на Kotlin DSL
description:
Трудно представить современное мобильное приложение без удаленной конфигурации - A/B-тесты, запуск новых фич, замена строк, графических ресурсов.

В ходе доклада мы рассмотрим как создать DSL на Kotlin для описания конфигурации приложения и как из него сгенерировать парсеры с валидацией, документацию и настройки разработчика.

speaker: Rainer Kern
title: GDG Bratislava
subject: Coroutines in Kotlin 1.3 & Assisted ViewModel Injection
description: Prezentácie si pre vás pripravili softvérový architekt a Kotlinový nadšenec Rainer Kern a šéf Android developerov v Sygicu Miroslav Kacera.

speaker: Cyril Findeling
title: Kotlin Paris Meetup
subject: Découvrir Kotlin avec des mini-jeux Android

speaker: Robin Penea
title: Kotlin Paris Meetup
subject: De Java à Kotlin: L'histoire d'une migration Android

speaker: Jag Saund
title: The San Francisco Android GDG
subject: Kotlin Coroutines and Channels: From 0 to 100
description: We all know multithreaded application development can make you 🤔😡. Chasing down deadlocks and race conditions can keep you up at night. But Kotlin introduces another way to tackle the problem. This talk introduces the fundamentals of both Coroutines and Channels with a simple Coffee Shop analogy. It'll take you from the foundation to a few different approaches on solving common problems. See how you can add Coroutines and Channels to your toolbox of asynchronous programming.

speaker: Sean Massie
title: Kotlin Portland User Group
subject: Kotlin, standing on the shoulders of Giants.
description: This talk will be a discussion on the wonders of Java and what Kotlin has done to build on them.

speaker: Lauren Yew
title: Google Developer Group Austin
subject: Threading Made Easy! A Busy Developer’s Guide to Kotlin Coroutines
description: - What coroutines are and how they function - How to use them (with real world examples and demos) - Where and why you should use coroutines in your app - How to avoid pitfalls of coroutines - How they compare to other threading solutions like callbacks and RxJava

speaker: Daniele Campogiani, Giovanni Catania
title: GDG DevFest Pisa 2019
subject: Functional Validation with Arrow and Bow
description: An introduction to some data types of Arrow and Bow: we will use them to validate a form in an application. Code samples will be in Kotlin and Swift

speaker: Jonas Schmid
title: Mobile Romandie Beer
subject: Kotlin for Swift developers
description: Swift and Kotlin have a lot of concepts in common but they also have a few notable differences. Knowing both languages can help you write better code and share ideas between developers of “the other platform”. > We will cover the basics of Kotlin before converting a Swift app into a Kotlin one. We will use concepts such as sealed classes, extensions and of course coroutines to make our code more robust and readable.

speaker: Nazarii Ivanchuk
title: Kotlin London
subject: Suspending functions, coroutines and state machines
description: Suspending functions, coroutines and state machines Explore. How Kotlin coroutine works under the hood. Introduction into the dark arts of the coroutines transformation during compilation.

speaker: Pablisco
title: Kotlin London
subject: A null hypothesis
description: We are going to explore how we use nullable types in Kotlin — going through the benefits, caveats and alternatives that can make or break our code. What can we do to make our code more readable, maintainable and less error bound? What should we avoid? It may contain traces of opinions.

speaker: Martial Maillot
title: Lyon Kotlin User Group
subject: La programmation orienté objet en Kotlin
description: 20 minutes en livecoding pour découvrir les listes.

speaker: Hadi Hariri
title: St. Petersburg Kotlin User Group
subject: Introduction to Ktor for server-side development
description: Ktor is an asynchronous web framework built from the the ground up using Kotlin and coroutines. It provides developers the ability to create both server and client applications targeting a variety of platforms including JVM, JavaScript and macOS, Windows and Linux via Kotlin/Native. In this talk we’re going to focus primarily on Ktor as a server application, see how simple it is to create asynchronous and robust server side applications, deployment models, features it provides out of the box, its extensibility model, and how it’s different to some of the other existing solutions on the market

speaker: Ionut Balosin
title: Voxxed Days Bucharest 2019
subject: Desugaring Kotlin features and their performance impact
description: In this presentation I will try to demystify a few Kotlin language features and to present how they are compiled into the bytecode in order to have a better understanding about what happens under the hood.

speaker: George Adams, Stephen Byrne
title: Kotlin Night Rochester
subject: Kotlin - A brief introduction to the language.
description: We will cover enough of the structure andsyntax that hopefully everybody will be able to follow along for the rest of the evening.

speaker: George Adams, Stephen Byrne
title: Kotlin Night Rochester
subject: Web Services - Comparison of the leading Kotlin-based web frameworks - Ktor andJavalin

speaker: George Adams, Stephen Byrne
title: Kotlin Night Rochester
subject: Desktop GUIs
description: TornadoFX, a JavaFX framework for Kotlin that uses type-safe buildersto make building views easy and readable.

speaker: George Adams, Stephen Byrne
title: Kotlin Night Rochester
subject: Coroutines - Asynchronous programming without expensive threads and context switches.

speaker: Venkat Subramaniam, Josh Long
title: DevNexus 2019
subject: Kotlin jumpstart with Venkat and Josh, part 1
description: A two hour, live-coded, presentation on getting you on the road to Kotlin with Josh Long and Venkat S!

speaker: Dev Gupta
title: DevNexus 2019
subject: Spring Boot and Kotlin
description: Let’s showcase how Kotlin makes Java developers lives easier in Spring Boot

speaker: Venkat Subramaniam
title: DevNexus 2019
subject: Developing Micronaut Applications with Kotlin
description: If you’re developing with Kotlin or getting started with the language, come to this talk to find out how to program your Micronaut application with Kotlin. Kotlin brings a variety of interesting features for fluency, type safety, and asynchronous programming. Learn how to leverage those capacities of the language in the context of Micronaut.

speaker: Pavel Vlodarskiy
title: SegFault University
subject: Kotlin plus Spring minus Adnotacje
description: Spring 5 dostał natywne wsparcie dla Kotlina z wygodnym DSLem i wygląda na to, że już po ludzku można ogarnąć konfigurację w trakcie kompilacji bez żadnych adnotacji, dziwnych CGlib proxy i majstrowania w runtime.

speaker: Marcin Moskala
title: SegFault University
subject: Kotlin for Java developers
description: What’s all the fuss about Kotlin? On this workshop, you will discover it yourself. It will cover the most important Kotlin features. Show null-safety, extension functions and why collection processing in Kotlin is so good.

speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
title: Voxxed Days Bucharest 2019
subject: Live Coding Kotlin/Native Snake
description: Dmitry Kandalov has been programming and trying to get better at it since DOS times. The last 10 years or so he spent in Java and JVM languages land, most recently focusing on Kotlin.

speaker: Victor Rentea
title: Kotlin Kindergarten
subject: Kotlin Kindergarten ep #02
description: Sick of Java? Let’s try Kotlin : probably the next de-facto standard for Android apps, and a cool compact language to write your JUnit tests in.

speaker: Mathias Düsterhöft
title: Serverless Hamburg
subject: Fighting cold startup issues for your Kotlin Lambda with GraalVM
description: how we can fight cold startup times for Kotlin or Java functions on AWS Lambda using GraalVM and the AWS newly announced Custom Lambda Runtimes.

speaker: Mathias Düsterhöft
title: Chicago Kotlin User Group
subject: Building and Using Kotlin DSL's
description:
Join us as we hear from two of our regular attendees, John Burns and Jonathan Bisson as they speak about building and utilizing Domain Specific Languages (DSLs for short) in Kotlin. Domain specific languages are subsets of functions in a programming language designed specifically to ease development and communicate intention more effectively within a particular problem-space.

John Burns will kick things off around 6pm by examining how Kotlin's language features enable us to construct a DSL for building static websites.

Jonathan Bisson will follow up speaking about how he utilizes Kotlin in his daily professional life and he will explore some of the applications he has built, some of the libraries used (SpringBoot, TornadoFX) and the science surrounding them.

speaker: Ersin Ertan
title: Kotlin Waterloo P2P
subject: Kotlin coroutines
description: Coroutines have large benefits over the regular threading model of Java. Most threads wait on IO 99% of the time and coroutines make use of this time to perform real work. Scalability is dramatically increased and memory consumption is reduced.

speaker: Ionut Balosin
title: Voxxed Days Bucharest 2019
subject: Desugaring Kotlin features and their performance impact
description: In this presentation I will try to demystify few Kotlin language features and to present how they are compiled into the bytecode in order to have a better understanding about what happens under the hood.

speaker: Mercedes Wyss
title: GreachConf
subject: Kotlin & Implications in an IoT project
description:
Develop IoT solutions with Kotlin is possible thanks to the incorporation to Kotlin as a first class programming language to Android and the becoming of Android Things, an optimized version of Android for embedded devices. This talk is looking for explore the aspects around IoT projects, Hardware, Security, Server Side, Data Analysis from the hand of Android Things and Kotlin.

The Internet of Things is a technology that has been echoing for some time. Arriving to generate interesting and attractive solutions. It usually happens that those who develop this type of solutions know about the Hardware, or they only have knowledge of the Software side. This talk seeks to explore all those aspects around IoT in the hand of a real project for monitoring fishbowls (something that you can implement at home).

In the hardware side, we will use sensors and different technologies for handle the information obtained from these (Raspberry PI, Arduino, etc). Since we want to show how to use Kotlin for develop IoT solutions, we will use Android Things with Kotlin and Raspberry PI.

The server side, using Serverless or IoT cloud solutions, options to analyze our information. Finally, is important take some considerations over the security aspects in IoT projects, although there are not yet 100% solid solutions, there are already efforts to solve this.

speaker: Josh Owens
title: Kotlin Portland User Group
subject: Our first kotlin android app
description: A look at how two Kroger apprentices built an internal app to facilitate regression testing on Android devices using deep links, Kotlin, MVVM patterns, and a node middleware server built with Koa. They will cover tools they found, UI patterns, and the learning experience behind building your first Android app.

speaker: Vicente Martínez
title: Guadalajara Hack Nights
subject: Room for Android in Kotlin
description: Room is a persistence library that provides a level of abstraction over SQLite. It has many advantages over traditional ORM's and we will be learning a proper use of it by creating a simple app that remind us when and how much to pay for our credit cards. We will be talking about some of the common designs to create relationships using DAOS in Room and accessing Live Data. Also, we will be discovering some hot topics using Kotlin for Android

speaker: Chris Koeberle
title: Kotlin DFW
subject: Kotlin Code Generation with KotlinPoet
description:
This talk will cover Kotlin code generation with KotlinPoet. KotlinPoet is a Kotlin (and Java) API for generating kotlin source files.

Sometimes a task is repetitive enough that it seems like you shouldn’t actually have to do it, but not so repetitive that you can just tell the IDE to handle it. KotlinPoet will help you generate Kotlin code, whether in an annotation processor, in a local script, or even to share a common definition between server and client. We’ll look at how it works, and some tips and tricks for solving common problems with it!

speaker: Valeriy Ovechkin
title: San Francisco Kotlin Meetup
subject: How Caviar migrated their Android app from Java to 100% Kotlin

speaker: KJ Jeon
title: Kotlin Night Seoul
subject: Effective Java and Kotlin
description: The book, 'Effective Java' introduces guidelines for implementing efficient and well-designed Java programs. Kotlin has a design that can be applied to these guidelines. The Kotlin Reference document cites this book to support the explanation. In this session, we will go over the rules of the 'Effective Java' and share how it is reflected in Kotlin or how it can be applied.

speaker: SH Lee
title: Kotlin Night Seoul
subject: Create elegant code using Kotlin
description: Introduction to how to make code elegant by using high order function, extension function, function literals with receivers, DSL etc. showing example of Kotlin code actually applied to FLO.

speaker: HS Kang
title: Kotlin Night Seoul
subject: Why Kotin? - from Java developer's point of view
description: We will share you why Java developers feel inconvenienced while using Java by comparing the Java example code with the Kotlin example code, introducing the merits and why the Java developers should change the project to Kotlin.

speaker: JW Heo
title: Kotlin Night Seoul
subject: Kotlin + AWS Lambda and API Gateway
description: Create and deploy a simple API using Kotlin and the AWS SAM (serverless application model). The script to build and distribute is also written in Kotlin (Gradle + Kotlin DSL).

speaker: Dmitry Kandalov
title: Kotlin London
subject: Live coding algorithms
description:
This is live coding session in Kotlin with TDD which will cover binary search, merge sort and heap/quick sort. Although these algorithms might seem simple, there are a few subtleties related to the algorithms and their implementation on JVM.

The session assumes that you're already familiar with the algorithms to some extent.

speaker: Guillermo Orellana
title: Kotlin London
subject: Kotlin Multiplatform
description:
Nowadays Kotlin is more than a JVM language - it allows you to target so many more different platforms.

In this talk we'll explore how Kotlin powers the creation of a web app that served as an introduction to full stack engineering for somebody with an Android background.

We will explore pros, cons and pitfalls and have fun deploying to the could!

speaker: Ignacio Arces
title: Guadalajara Kotlin User Group
subject: Painless Dependency InjeKtion
description: Hablaremos de la importancia de DI para crear código modular y altamente testeable. Diferentes tipos de DI con PROs/CONs y daremos un vistazo a las diferentes opciones disponibles para implementar DI con Kotlin; desde las librerías tradicionales de Java como Spring y Guice hasta las opciones 100% Kotlin como KoDeIn e Insert-Koin

speaker: David Cordova
title: Guadalajara Kotlin User Group
subject: The Strategy and Komposition
description: Muchas buenas practicas vienen incluidas en Kotlin por la misma forma en que esta diseñado el lenguaje y una de ellas es el favorecer la composicion de clases. Hablaremos de porque es ventajoso tener esto sobre la herencia y como podemos implementar el patron de Strategy en nuestros proyectos.

speaker: Zachary Smith
title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: Intro to Web Dev with Kotlin
description: With front-end web apps becoming larger and more complex, and Node.js allowing Javascript to be used on the server side, the language has had a rapid rise in popularity. But for many JVM/Android developers, the thought of getting into front end web development and the Javascript ecosystem can seem quite unpleasant. However with Kotlin's ability to target JS, we can leverage the language features we've come to love, to make the experience a bit more fun. In this talk, we'll explore how we can build a Kotlin front-end application and even use Kotlin to interact with Node.js on the server.

speaker: Brian Plummer
title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: Moshi: Kotlin Codegen
description: Learn how to leverage Moshi’s Kotlin codegen so your data model can be immutable and quickly parsed reflection free. I’ll discuss why this is important to us as developers, integration details, and how Moshi implemented this feature!

speaker: Constantine Bialik
title: Kotlin Office Hours
subject: Kotlin-DSL for Gradle: How to convert Gradle scripts to Kotlin
description:
Now it's more then a year since Gradle officially supports Kotlin-DSL to define projects. This (and JetBrain’s effort to support of Kotlin-Native) allows to develop most of the projects COMPLETELY in Kotlin including server side, client side, native/mobile application and build/test scripts.

However most project generating tools still create Gradle scripts in Groovy only. Even IntelliJ IDEA creates Kotlin projects with Groovy script for Gradle.

Now is the perfect time for this presentation to demonstrate how easy it is to convert Groovy script for Gradle to Kotlin-DSL script for Gradle.

speaker: Lorenz Schmoliner
title: Developer Meetup Kärnten
subject: Quick Intro zu Kotlin Native
description: Kotlin Native ermöglicht es euch Kotlin Code zu schreiben und diesen dann zu nativem plattform-spezifischen Code zu kompilieren. Unterstützte Zielplattformen sind unter anderem iOS und Android. Lorenz wird euch in einem Intro zeigen, was man sich darunter vorstellen kann.

speaker: Krzysztof Korbacz, Paweł Pyzik
title: Kielce Java User Group
subject: Kotlin na backendzie
description:
Zastanawialiście się ostatnio czy ten nowy projekt backendowy jest dobrym miejscem by spróbować Kotlina (i nie chodzi nam o ketchup)?

Ale wszystko co wiecie na temat Kotlina to wiedza pozyskana z kilku prezentacji lub blog postów, które mówią jak młodzieżowy jest to język?

Może dobrym pomysłem byłoby zapytać kogoś kto tego spróbował na własnej skórze? I oto jesteśmy my by opowiedzieć Wam naszą historię transformacji z Java Backend do Java/Kotlin Backend developerów.

Opowiemy Wam jakie Kotlin kryje w sobie pułapki, które ficzery Kotlina podobają nam się najbardziej. Przeprowadzimy Was przez recepty, które zebraliśmy w trakcie prac nad naszym ostatnim projektem.

A jako wisienka na torcie: powiemy Wam czy wybralibyśmy Kotlina ponownie dysponując wiedzą, którą dysponujemy dzisiaj.

speaker: Pedro Alves
title: Kotlin Lisboa
subject: Porque escolhi Kotlin para ensinar programação

speaker: Fábio Rito
title: Kotlin Lisboa
subject:
Lightweightform - Utilização prática da linguagem em contexto multiplataforma para validar dados no
            Frontend e Backend

speaker: Alonso Torres
title: Madrid GUG
subject: Kotlin para Grooviers
description:
Google lo soporta como lenguaje de primer nivel para Android, muchas bibliotecas le dan soporte al primer nivel e incluso nuestro querido Gradle lo va a usar para implementar su DSL alternativa./p>

No es ningún secreto que Jetbrains, los creadores del lenguaje, se inspiraron muchísimo en Groovy. Eso nos coloca a los programadores de Groovy en un punto ideal porque con poco esfuerzo podemos aprender este nuevo lenguaje trayéndonos mucha experiencia./p>

En esta charla voy a hacer un recorrido por algunas de las principales características del lenguaje y ponerlas frente a frente con Groovy. Veremos ventajas e inconvenientes de las dos aproximaciones y espero que salgáis con bastante ideas de cómo es el lenguaje.

speaker: Mercedes Wyss
title: JBCNConf
subject: Kotlin & Implications in an IoT project
description: Develop IoT solutions with Kotlin is possible thanks to the incorporation to Kotlin as a first class programming language to Android and the becoming of Android Things, an optimized version of Android for embedded devices. This talk is looking for explore the aspects around IoT projects, Hardware, Security, Server Side, Data Analysis from the hand of Android Things and Kotlin. The Internet of Things is a technology that has been echoing for some time. Arriving to generate interesting and attractive solutions. It usually happens that those who develop this type of solutions know about the Hardware, or they only have knowledge of the Software side. This talk seeks to explore all those aspects around IoT in the hand of a real project for monitoring fishbowls (something that you can implement at home). In the hardware side, we will use sensors and different technologies for handle the information obtained from these (Raspberry PI, Arduino, etc). Since we want to show how to use Kotlin for develop IoT solutions, we will use Android Things with Kotlin and Raspberry PI. The server side, using Serverless or IoT cloud solutions, options to analyze our information. Finally, is important take some considerations over the security aspects in IoT projects, although there are not yet 100% solid solutions, there are already efforts to solve this.

speaker: Paulien van Alst, Brian Vermeer
title: JBCNConf
subject: My Kotlin is better than your Java!
description: TLDR: The big discussion: Kotlin or Java, to migrate or not to migrate and why... The world of languages on the JVM has seen alternatives to Java come and go. Kotlin is probably the most popular one at this moment. Although Java is still one of the most commonly used programming languages, Kotlin seems to keep growing very fast. Where Java is known for its verbosity, Kotlin aims at making programming easier. On the other hand, Kotlin is a mix of paradigms and forces you to learn yet another language. Moreover, with all the new features that are rapidly introduced in Java, is Kotlin actually needed? So what are the aspects where they differ from each other? In which situations should we choose the one or the other? Should we migrate to Kotlin or is Java good enough? As Kotlin claims full interoperability with Java, should we even choose? In this talk we will fire up the battle between Kotlin and Java. In this battle one of us will root for Java while the other cheers for Kotlin. Who wins? That is totally up to you. The audience will be judge and jury. So...bring it on.

speaker: Nicolás Patarino
title: GreachConf
subject: When Clean Architecture met Kotlin: A love story
description: Kotlin, a modern language bursts into the community when developers have been perfecting what they call Clean Architecture for years, some potions and spells with which to increase the power of testability and become independent of evil external agents and cruel frameworks.

speaker: Alberto de Avila
title: GreachConf
subject: GRAALVM with Groovy & Kotlin
description: Have you heard about GRAALVM? Maybe yes, but, how can we use it? In this talk we are going to see how to create images to execute our JVM applications faster and what are the GRAALVM limitations when using Groovy or Kotlin as program languagues

speaker: Adit Lal
title: BlrKotlin
subject: Empower Session: The Power Of Kotlin
description: Societe Generale which is regarded among the most forward thinking banks is organizing a meetup to structure a network of enthusiastic professionals around development trends in financial infrastructure surrounding Kotlin.This talk introduces and highlights how we could use Kotlin DSL’s and add some readability of code by enforcing the use of declarative code with minimum boilerplate, as well as look at why Kotlin is particularly good for DSLs with examples. And we are doing this with BlrKotlin (Bengaluru’s favourite Kotlin User Group).

speaker: Benoit Hebrard
title: Kotlin Copenhagen User Group
subject: Sealed classes
description: Sealed classes are often described as enums on steroids. This talk will be an introduction to how sealed classes work, and some practical applications for them.

speaker: Adrian Catalan
title: GDG Androidtitlan
subject: If your code looks like it's Kotlin & quacks like it's Kotlin, then it probably is swift.

speaker: Kevin Janvier
title: Kotlin Uganda User Group
subject: Intro to Web Dev with Kotlin
description: With front-end web apps becoming larger and more complex, and Node.js allowing Javascript to be used on the server side, the language has had a rapid rise in popularity. But for many JVM/Android developers, the thought of getting into front end web development and the Javascript ecosystem can seem quite unpleasant. However with Kotlin's ability to target JS, we can leverage the language features we've come to love, to make the experience a bit more fun. In this talk, we'll explore how we can build a Kotlin front-end application and even use Kotlin to interact with Node.js on the server. Learn how to leverage Kevin’s Kotlin codegen so your data model can be immutable and quickly parsed reflection free. I’ll discuss why this is important to us as developers, integration details, and how Moshi implemented this feature!

speaker: Alexey Shafranov
title: Taganrog Kotlin User Group
subject: Исключения в Kotlin и их особенности

speaker: Andrey Tereshchenko
title: Taganrog Kotlin User Group
subject: Корутины. Гибкое асинхронное программирование в Kotlin

speaker: Andrey Antipov
title: Samara Kotlin User Groups
subject: Тестируем выразительность языка (ломаем компилятор) на примере Kotlin
description: На что стоит обратить внимание при исследовании выразительных средств нового языка программирования. С какими багами и непонятностями я столкнулся в процессе исследования Kotlin

speaker: S M Mohi-Us Sunnat
title: Bangladesh Kotlin User Group
subject: A Day with Kotlin for DIU Students
description:
This is the first meetup arranged by Bangladesh Kotlin User Group for the developers of Bangladesh. In this meetup, there will be the expertise Kotlin developers of Bangladesh who will be sharing their view on Kotlin.

What will you get to know: 1) What are the scopes of using Kotlin 2) How it can ease the coding experience 3) What are the ways it benefits a developer to code? 4) Why Kotlin is the new future of Android development. 5) How to use this language in an app (Demonstration) 6) Object-oriented programming with Kotlin 7) Android with Kotlin

speaker: S M Mohi-Us Sunnat
title: Bangladesh Kotlin User Group
subject: Basic Uses of Kotlin in Android and Spring
description: Start with the Past, Present & Future of Kotlin. What will be the Future scopes of Kotlin Developers? Demonstrate the Basic Uses of Kotlin Android and Server with some simple code. Lastly, invite to join the Facebook group.

speaker: Alex Dunn
title: NDC London
subject: Kotlin for C# Developers
description: Dive into the latest craze in languages and platforms - Kotlin. This time we will be looking at it from the perspective of a .NET C# developer, draw comparisons between the languages, and bridge the gap between these 2 amazing languages. We'll look at: Kotlin as a language Platforms Kotlin is great for Object Oriented Implementations in Kotlin Extended Features Features Kotlin has that C# doesn't A demo Android application in Kotlin vs a Xamarin.Android app in C# In the end you will leave with a foundational knowledge of Kotlin and its capabilities to build awesome apps with less code. You should feel comfortable comparing C# applications to Kotlin applications and know where to find resources to learn even more!

speaker: Shady Selim
title: Career Launcher 6.0
subject: What's New with Kotlin for Android
description: What's New with Kotlin for Android

speaker: Andy Balaam
title: ACCU 2019
subject: Kotlin makes your Java code better
description: Concrete examples, based on real-world code, of how converting Java code to Kotlin improves it. We will cover: * Reducing the amount of code for common patterns like value objects and default parameters * Preventing errors using immutability, null safety and explicit inheritance * Expressing ideas more directly using pattern matching, sealed classes and conditional expressions * Less verbose functional-style code like streams and lambdas * Clearer object structure with primary and secondary constructors One of the joys of Kotlin is how easy it is to make a gradual transition from Java. All of the examples will demonstrate code that can be dropped in to an existing Java code base with little or no disruption. If we have time, we'll discuss things we wish were in Kotlin, and whether any of them are plausible on the JVM platform.

speaker: Ebuka Onyebinamma
title: Kotlin Benin User group
subject: Kotlin community: A necessity for every modern society
description: In recent times in the Tech world, precisely the software Engineering space, new technologies have evolved with kotlin as one of them, which has a very concise syntax, but powerful abilities and very versatile. Therefore, there is a need for every society to have a Kotlin community where members will be guided on learning the language and use it to solve problems around them.

speaker: Geoffrey Métais
title: Paris Android User Group
subject: Modern concurrency on Android with Kotlin
description:
Le framework Android actuel, basé sur Java incite beaucoup à créer des "callback hells" et de nombreux points de blocage via des mutex, car nous n'avons pas de moyen plus simple de garantir la "thread safety".

Avec les coroutines, Kotlin apporte un framework complet et efficace pour s'occuper de la concurrence d'une manière plus performante et surtout plus simple.

Ce talk a pour but de montrer comment tirer parti des coroutines pour se débarraser des callbacks et des synchonize.

speaker: Aubry Alexandre et Duponchel Nicolas
title: Paris Android User Group
subject: Rx vs Coroutines
description:
La librairie Rx est une solution efficace et assez répandue pour traiter l’asynchronisme. Depuis l’arrivée de Kotlin une nouvelle solution est disponible : les coroutines.

Dans cette présentation nous exposerons les basiques de Rx et des Coroutines. Nous mettrons ensuite en confrontation les 2 solutions via des cas d’usages simples, afin de tirer les avantages de chaque techno. Finalement nous essaierons ensemble de comprendre les philosophies de chaque solution.

speaker: Geoffrey Marizy
title: Paris Android User Group
subject: Wrapping Android callbacks
description:
Les coroutines et RxJava c'est bien joli mais le framework Android lui repose sur les callbacks.

Durant cette présentation, on va étendre la plateforme Android pour utiliser d'autres mécanismes ; coroutines, RxJava et LiveData. Je vous présenterai quelques techniques pour encapsuler les callbacks, et les avantages que l'on peut en tirer.

speaker: Anna Opoka
title: GDG Wrocław
subject: Kotlin Coroutines
description: Na warsztatach poznamy podstawowe elementy korutyn oraz sposoby na wykorzystanie ich w Androidowym projekcie. Przerobimy także przykładową aplikację z callbacków na Kotlin Coroutines.

speaker: Saúl Buentello
title: Kotlin CDMX User Group
subject: Coroutines vs Threads, are they any different?
description: When you read the documentation, it is said that coroutines can be suspended without blocking a thread but what is the difference between blocking and suspending? What happens when you launch a coroutine or start a thread?

speaker: Rafael Toledo, Consultor Líder
title: Kotlin Meetup - São Paulo
subject: Kotlin no backend com ktor
description: E pra esse encontro vamos ter um workshop bem legal sobre como utilizar Kotlin no Backend com ktor, com o Rafael Toledo, Consultor Lider na ThoughtWorks. Vamos aprender na prática comoLevem seus notebooks, vai ser daora! :)

speaker: Davide Cerbo
title: DevDay Salerno
subject: Kotlin: forse è la volta buona
description: Dopo 20 anni Java inizia a sentire il peso degli anni e la sua sintassi non evolve come vorremmo, ma la JVM resta sempre un ambiente affidabile ed è già in produzione presso moltissime aziende. Negli ultimi anni sono usciti molti linguaggi basati sulla JVM, ma non tutti hanno avuto il successo sperato. Kotlin ha conquistato Android e, ora, grazie a una sintassi intuitiva e grandi aziende che lo supportano potrebbe essere molto utilizzato anche nelle applicazioni web.

speaker: Michael Schneider
title: Hamburg Data Science Meetup
subject: Data hacking, from fast prototyping to production systems in order personalize Jimdo websites
description: A tool stack overview on building non blocking and near real time data products in Kotlin in order to personalize websites at Jimdo. From data sourcing using apache drill to rapid prototyping, addressing the importance of machine learning evaluation, production problems and finally a/b testing with live users. Embracing the data driven culture of learning and failing fast.

speaker: Evgeny Zakharov
title: Kotlin Moscow
subject: Kotlin, посмотрим насколько глубока кроличья нора
description: Порой возникают вопросы, почему в Kotlin некоторые вещи сделаны так, а не иначе. И на что стоит обратить внимание, если производительность играет не последнюю роль? Где же найти все ответы? Байткод! Заглянем внутрь, посмотрим на его декомпилированный вариант в Java, и большая часть вопросов исчезнет!

speaker: Vladislav Verminsky
title: Kotlin Moscow
subject: Поваренная книга Kotlin Native/MPP
description: Цель доклада — рассказать о том, что такое Kotlin Native и Multiplatform, как они связаны между собой и чем отличаются, для каких целей используются. Познакомиться с компилятором kotlin-native и его инструментами, как создавать проекты через gradle, их структура и возможности плагинов. Создадим, скомпилируем и запустим проекты для Kotlin Native — C и Kotlin MPP — JS.

speaker: Vladislav Verminsky
title: GDG Android Athens
subject: An introduction to Kotlin Coroutines for Android
description: Coroutines that fascinated devs from its early beta have graduated the experimental phase and are now stable 🎓. Coroutines provide a way to write asynchronous code sequentially making multithreaded programming more debuggable and maintainable. In this presentation Antonis will try to guide you through the main features of Coroutines that make it so special.

speaker: Marharyta Nedzelska
title: JavaDay Lviv 2019
subject: Rediscovering gRPC with Kotlin coroutines
description: Microservice architecture is now a huge trend...

speaker: Sergey Zolotov
title: JavaDay Lviv 2019
subject: Kotlin Coroutines in Practice
description: Kotlin coroutines are a hot topic and were released this year. We use them in our projects on backend. In this talk I will show you how to use it in real back-end based applications, common patterns and problems you could face

speaker: Mariana Bocoi
title: Go See Tech Talks #9
subject: Intro to Kotlin
description: Kotlin starts to take more space in the coding world. Why is it an interesting language? How is it different than Java? Why would one switch? For our next tech talk, we have invited Mariana Bocoi - a software developer at Volvo Car Mobility - who will try to answer these questions and share her experience from working in Java, Clojure and now Kotlin. Most of the comparisons will be to Java.

speaker: Martial Maillot
title: Lyon Kotlin User Group
subject: La programmation orienté objet en Kotlin
description: Livecoding pour découvrir les classes et extensions.

speaker: Nino Handler
title: GDG Nuremberg Android
subject: Kotlin - why, how, when - why?
description: Nino will give you reasons to switch to Kotlin if you haven't done yet and explain why it is nothing to be afraid of. A big part of the talk will be about interoperability between Kotlin and Java and how to call Kotlin code from Java.

speaker: Sergey Krukov, Kirill Rozov, Ruslan Ibragimov
title: School.kt
subject: Kotlin Ecosystem

speaker: Martial Maillot
title: Lyon Kotlin User Group
subject: Tests unitaires, une bonne recette
description:
Découverte : La programmation orienté objet en Kotlin : 20 minutes en livecoding pour découvrir la syntaxe et les outils proposés.

Confirmé : Tests unitaires, une bonne recette. Comment rendre vos tests unitaires plus lisible et concis avec Kotlin.

speaker: Andy Chow
title: Kotlin Waterloo P2P
subject: Testing with Kotlin
description: Andy will demonstrate how testing with Kotlin is significantly cleaner, easier and more enjoyable than Java. Testing can take advantage of the majority of Kotlin features and has some very easy to use frameworks. As a result, testing is one of the easiest ways to start making the switch from Java to Kotlin or to begin your Kotlin journey, so this is a must see talk!

speaker: Jendrik Johannes
title: Kotlin User Group Hamburg
subject: Dependency Management in Gradle 5 and beyond
description:
The Java ecosystem allows developers to profit from a large pool of reusable libraries. Traditionally, the platform-independence of Java always made it easy to publish and share ready-to-use libraries. As Kotlin and Android developers, we also profit from this existing catalogue of libraries. However, new challenges for dealing with dependencies in the JVM world emerged over the past years, as software systems grew further in complexity and new platforms, such as Kotlin or Android, emerged.

Dependency management is one of the major functionalities of the Gradle Build Tool.

Gradle 5 offers a number of new stable features to support developers in managing dependencies – and more can be expected soon.

speaker: Garth Gilmour
title: Kotlin Limerick User Group
subject: Kotlin - The Whole Damn Family
description: Kotlin has seen rapid adoption over the last two years, and is now mainstream on the JVM. But that is only the start of the story. During 2018 Kotlin JS became a realistic option for browser based apps, with extensive support for building UI's in React. This year will see the emergence of Kotlin Native, enabling you to write programs that run outside of the JVM across a range of platforms. Best of all your common code can be managed via multiplatform projects and libraries, ending the duplication of type declarations in distributed systems. In this talk Garth will present examples of both Kotlin JS Web apps and Kotlin Native programs and talk about the stability, maturity and long term prospects for each.

speaker: Alonso Torres
title: Madrid Groovy User Group
subject: Kotlin para Grooviers
description:
Google lo soporta como lenguaje de primer nivel para Android, muchas bibliotecas le dan soporte al primer nivel e incluso nuestro querido Gradle lo va a usar para implementar su DSL alternativa.

No es ningún secreto que Jetbrains, los creadores del lenguaje, se inspiraron muchísimo en Groovy. Eso nos coloca a los programadores de Groovy en un punto ideal porque con poco esfuerzo podemos aprender este nuevo lenguaje trayéndonos mucha experiencia.

En esta charla voy a hacer un recorrido por algunas de las principales características del lenguaje y ponerlas frente a frente con Groovy. Veremos ventajas e inconvenientes de las dos aproximaciones y espero que salgáis con bastante ideas de cómo es el lenguaje.

speaker: Bob Dahlberg
title: Jfokus 2019
subject: Quickie: Pitfalls when mixing Kotlin & Java
description:
I've had my fair share of android projects being converted to Kotlin from Java and I thought I'd share the lessons I've learned doing so. There are a few subtle pitfalls that are very easy to fall into.

So this is gonna be a quickie about my best practices and how to avoid doing the same mistakes I've made and seen

speaker: Justin D Lee
title: Jfokus 2019
subject: Kotlin is as awesome as you've heard. Here's why.
description: Most presentations introducing a new language are really just language tours. A lot of interesting language features are shown but it's not always clear why one would choose to adopt that new language. This presentation looks at a number of interesting features of the language and ecosystem that are more interesting than just a fancy new for loop. No one switch languages because of a for loop. So we'll look at a number of "big ticket" features of the language and ecosystem that do more to distinguish Kotlin than mere syntax sugar alone can provide. It will reasonably fast paced as we try to cover as many interesting tidbits as we can get through.

speaker: Anton Arhipov
title: Jfokus 2019
subject: Kotlin DSL in 45 minutes
description:
Learn how to create type-safe and statically typed DSLs in Kotlin. Uncover the language features that makes DSL creation possible. Well take a look at a few practical examples and create a simple DSL ourselves.

The session starts with an introduction to DSL related Kotlin language features. Next, we create a simple DSL in a live coding session and then continue adding expressiveness and language features. We cover a number of examples, like JSON or XML builders, data binding, configuration & template engines.

speaker: Roman Elizarov
title: GOTO Conference 2019
subject: Asynchronous Programming with Kotlin
description: This workshop covers asynchronous programming in Kotlin using coroutines. It starts with basics of asynchronous programming and its differences from blocking code and introduces concepts of suspending functions and coroutines. Dealing with the ecosystem of blocking code on JVM is covered in depth as well as best practices for managing cancellation of asynchronous operations. The workshop also covers more advanced topics of concurrent decomposition of work via futures, deep dive into coroutine contexts and includes an overview of Communication Sequential Process (CSP) approach and channels.

speaker: Marek Multarzyński
title: Kotlin Night Warsaw
subject: Interoperability with Kotlin
description: In this presentation I would like to introduce the audience to the Kotlin Native compilation. We will determine its reasonable use. I will show the result of Kotlin Native compilation on many platforms. We will make a comparison between Kotlin Native approach and native solutions.

speaker: Krzysztof Romanowski
title: Kotlin Night Warsaw
subject: The price we all pay. Does Kotlin slow down our code?
description:
Kotlin, as well as other languages like Scala or Groovy is developed (echm, hacked, eckm) over JVM. We all enjoy features like extension methods or strict null management that does not have corresponding functionalities native to JVM. How does that affect performance?

Let’s run some benchmarks!

speaker: Sean Mcquillan
title: Chicago Roboto 2019
subject: Launching Into Coroutines
description: Kotlin coroutines are a new way to manage async operations on Android. Stable with Kotlin 1.3 now is a great time to explore using coroutines in your app. In this talk you’ll learn about the history coroutines, how they work in Kotlin, and effective patterns for using coroutines on Android. The talk will also cover how to avoid common pitfalls and mistakes with using coroutines. After this talk you will have a good understanding of Kotlin coroutines and how to effectively use them on Android!

speaker: Huyen Tue Dao
title: Chicago Roboto 2019
subject: Dissecting the stdlib II
description: One of the best places to learn idiomatic Kotlin is the stdlib. Now I don’t mean just using the stdlib but going to the source, literally. In this session, we’ll look at some of the methods and tools inside the stdlib and dig into how they’re written to reveal intermediate to advanced language features, slick syntax and conventions, and high-level abstractions to help you write more fluent objects and interfaces. We’ll also take a few glances at the underlying bytecode to understand how and why the features work the way they do.

speaker: Ronan Doyle
title: South East Tech Meetup
subject: Kotlin vs Java for Android
description: While Kotlin can be used to develop server-side, web and native OS applications, this talk will focus on highlighting some of the benefits of using Kotlin over Java when developing Android applications.

speaker: Danny Preussler
title: MobileTechCon
subject: Kotlin vs. Java
description:
Geht es nach Google, ist Kotlin die Zukunft der Android-Entwicklung. Erst vor etwas mehr als einem Jahr als „First-Class Citizen“ offiziell für die Android Plattform freigegeben, setzen heute bereits mehr als 25% der Top 1000 Android Anwendungen aus dem Play Store auf Kotlin. Und noch wichtiger: Die Zufriedenheit der Entwickler liegt laut Umfrage bei 97% und damit deutlich über dem vergleichbaren Wert für Java.

Der Grund hierfür liegt klar auf der Hand. Die speziell für die Entwicklung von Android Apps geschaffene Sprache ist die direkte Antwort auf viele Probleme, die sich durch die Verwendung von Java im Android-Umfeld ergeben. Sie vereint dabei das Beste aus objektorientierter und funktionaler Programmiersprache und unterstützt so die Entwickler optimal mit Inter-Operabilität, Sicherheit und Tool Support.

Der Workshop stellt Kotlin aus Sicht eines Android-Entwicklers vor und zeigt, welche Vorteile die Verwendung der neuen Programmiersprache mit sich bringen kann. Natürlich gehen wir dabei auch auf mögliche Migrationsszenarien und das Zusammenspiel von Java und Kotlin ein.

speaker: Joost Heikoop
title: Brabant.scala
subject: Kotlin vs. Java
description: We have almost 20 years of Scala experience between us and have experience with many other languages. Recently we have jumped onto Kotlin, because it look very promising as Java competitor. Of course there is no one size fits all solution. We will show how the two languages compare and explain why and when, you should pick one over the other. Or maybe should consider some else all together.

speaker: Marharyta Nedzelska
title: Voxxed Days Zürich
subject: Building microservices with Kotlin and gRPC

speaker: Pavel Finkelstein
title: JUG.ru
subject: Kotlin два года в проде и ни единого разрыва

speaker: Ben Boral
title: Austin Kotlin Meetup
subject: Ktor "a Kotlin framework for building asynchronous servers and clients in connected systems."
description: This month, Ben Boral will present a REST API he is building using Ktor. This talk will explain how to build a REST API in Kotlin with Ktor assuming zero prior Ktor knowledge.

speaker: Mohit Sarveiya
title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: Dissecting Coroutines
description: 2019 maybe be the year of Kotlin coroutines. What is a coroutine anyway? A coroutine is an instance of a state machine and a suspending function defines the state machine. What does that mean? Join me in this talk as we will explore the ins and out of coroutines. We will dive deep into channels, actors and the reactive streams modules. We’ll also look at their usage to solve common async problems in Android.

speaker: Brent Watson
title: New York Kotlin Meetup
subject: Advanced Kotlin
description: Brent will be giving the talk that he presented at droidcon nyc and droidcon sf on "Advanced Kotlin". We'll cover some of the more advanced features of Kotlin in this talk such as delegates, annotation use-site targets, tailrec, reflection, and much more.

speaker: Sébastien Deleuze
title: The Brussels Java User Group
subject: Spring Boot with Kofu and Coroutines
description:
This presentation will give me the opportunity to present the upcoming official support of coroutines in Spring (Framework, Boot, Data) as well as Kofu, the Kotlin DSL, developed within the the Spring Fu incubator that I started a few months ago, which goal is to configure Spring Boot in a more explicit as well as more efficient manner.

My live coding will demonstrate how to develop a Spring Boot application with Kofu by using the new Coroutine API's from WebFlux and Spring Data R2DBC (Reactive SQL).

We will also compare Reactive API's versus Coroutines (pros and cons) to help you make informed decisions.

speaker: Dennis Dierkes, Ruben Gees
title: Bielefelder Kotlin User Group
subject: Sealed Classes, Reified Generics and Ktor
description:
Den Anfang macht Ruben (https://github.com/rubengees) mit Sealed Classes. Sealed Classes erweitern Enums um alle Funktionalitäten einer traditionellen Klasse und sind besonders nützlich im Zusammenhang mit Generics und dem speziellen Typ Nothing.

Anschließend erzählt Robin (https://github.com/roschlau) etwas über Reified Generics, welche im Gegensatz zu Java die Typinformationen auch innerhalb der Funktion verfügbar machen, was zu lesbarerem Code führt.

Den Schluss macht Dennis (https://github.com/deen13) mit Ktor, einem Framework zur Erstellung webbasierter API's mit minimalem Aufwand.

speaker: Ellen Shapiro
title: Appdevcon 2019
subject: Kotlin/Native: The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly
description: The promise of write-once-run-everywhere has haunted native mobile developers since the first time someone whispered the words “phone gap”. But what if there was a way to have cross-platform development with a modern, type-safe language? JetBrains is trying to make this happen with Kotlin/Native, which compiles to LLVM bytecode, and can run on iOS, Android, and even the web. Learn more about some of the benefits of working with Kotlin/Native, some of the drawbacks, and a few of the (current) potential dealbreakers when it comes to using this exciting new technology in a real app.

speaker: Sean McQuillan
title: GOTO Conference 2019
subject: Embracing the Future in a Multi-Platform World: A Kotlin Story
description:
So you know Kotlin, but you aren’t sure you’re utilizing it to its full potential across platforms?

If you’re not sure about what Coroutines really have to offer or if you want to share your business logic between Android and other platforms, this session is your next step to becoming a Kotlin expert and your lesson on how to thrive in a multi-language world.

In this session, you’ll learn how to write a multiplatform utility class and how Coroutines can live next to RxJava.

speaker: Fabio Collini
title: GDG DevFest Pisa 0.1
subject: From Java to Kotlin beyond Alt+Shift+Cmd+K
description: Kotlin is a first-class language for Android development since Google I/O 2017. And it’s here to stay! Thanks to Android Studio it’s really easy to introduce Kotlin in an existing project, the configuration is trivial and then we can convert Java classes to Kotlin using a Alt+Shift+Cmd+K. But the new syntax is the just beginning, using Kotlin we can improve our code making it more readable and simpler to write. In this talk we’ll see how to use some Kotlin features (for example data classes, collections, coroutines and delegates) to simplify Android development comparing the code with the equivalent “modern” Java code. It’s not fair to compare Kotlin code with plain Java 6 code so the Java examples will use lambdas and some external libraries like RxJava and AutoValue.

speaker: Roberto Orgiu
title: GDG DevFest Pisa 0.1
subject: EAsync Kotlin
description: Writing async code is never easy, but nowadays we have many solutions. One approach would be to use RxJava and its schedulers but... have you heard of Kotlin Coroutines? Join us and let's see how good they are today!

speaker: James Mark Coggan
title: GDG DevFest Pisa 0.1
subject: How to test your Android Things code in a clean way with Kotlin
description: Android things gives you the ability to connect all those Internet of things devices you have around all together. But how can you test it? In this talk you will learn in a practical way how to structure your Android Things project so you can write proper unit tests that don’t depend on your sensors, actuators or the Android framework.

speaker: Fabio Collini, Roberto Orgiu
title: GDG DevFest Pisa 0.1
subject: Kotlin Codelab Part 2 - Extra Registration needed!
description: Kotlin è un linguaggio di programmazione utilizzabile su piattaforma JVM e, dall’ultimo Google I/O, supportato ufficialmente su Android. Durante il Codelab sarà mostrato come convertire a Kotlin una app Android scritta in Java. L'app è composta da sei classi Java, le classi saranno convertite una ad una in Kotlin analizzando la sintassi di questo linguaggio e i vari costrutti utilizzabili. L'esempio è disponibile qui: https://github.com/fabioCollini/KotlinCodelab IMPORTANTE: Visto il numero ridotto di posti, per questo codelab é obbligatorio registarsi qui: http://bit.ly/dfpi17-codelab

speaker: Nagy Bence
title: Kotlin Budapest User Group
subject: Type Safety with Inline Classes
description: From measuring elapsed time to querying database objects, representing different concepts with primitive values is a common practice in many programming languages. Luckily, Kotlin’s new inline classes enable us to accurately represent these concepts in a type-safe and efficient manner.

speaker: Voros Gyula
title: Kotlin Budapest User Group
subject: Micronaut + Kotlin
description: Micronaut is a modern, JVM-based, full-stack framework for building modular, easily testable microservice and serverless applications. And it pairs amazingly well with Kotlin - Gyula is here to tell you all about it.

speaker: Matt Berteaux
title: Kotlin Utah User Group
subject: Intro to Ktor
description: This month we are going to learn about Ktor a "framework for quickly creating connected applications in Kotlin with minimal effort."

speaker: Daniel Gruici
title: Seattle Kotlin
subject: Statefulness is fun! Except when it gets cumbersome.
description: We will be talking about how being stateful in your applications can be useful (especially with Kotlin's help), some pitfalls and not so great stuff that can come up as you go, as well as how it greatly benefits testing for both UI and Unit tests.

speaker: Ravi Subramanian
title: Seattle Kotlin
subject: A deep dive into adb
description: What does `adb lolcat` do? A deep dive into adb

speaker: Jan Völker
title: Kotlin User Group Düsseldorf
subject: How to write an interpreter in Kotlin
description: In this talk we'll show you how to write a simple interpreter from scratch. No dependencies, no tricks just pure kotlin.

speaker: Yassine Benabbas
title: Lille Android User Group
subject: Les nouveautés de Kotlin 1.3 en Live Coding
description:
Découvrons ensemble les nouveautés de Kotlin 1.3. Au programme on verra notamment les inline classes, les contrats et la les coroutines qui ont été stabilisées.

Live coding signifie que tout sera illustré avec du code et un IDE (IntelliJ). Donc c’est garanti 0% slides.

speaker: Salomon Brys
title: Lille Android User Group
subject: Kotlin pour Android, iOS et le Web
description:
Kotlin est un des langages officiels pour le développement Android, et il est maintenant officiellement supporté par plusieurs framework backends comme Spring. Saviez vous que vous pouvez utiliser Kotlin pour compiler pour iOS via LLVM ou pour le web via JS ?

Durant cette présentation, je montrerai comment créer une application mobile qui tourne sur Android, sur iOS et sur le web tout en restant fidèle à chaque plateforme.

speaker: Ohad Shai
title: KotlinTLV
subject: Playing with Kotlin Workshop
description: We will meet again, with a different format. This time we will hold a workshop so please bring your laptop. In this workshop, we will implement the game of 2048 together. The exercise is originally a part of the 'Kotlin for Java Developers' course that is taught by JetBrains. We will have IntelliJ IDE Ultimate licenses as prizes.

speaker: Krzysztof Korbacz
title: Kraków Kotlin User Group
subject: Lesson learned - Kotlin on backend
description:
Have you recently wondered if this new backend project is a good moment to jump into Kotlin, but all you know about it was those blog posts and presentations saying how cool is it?

Maybe it is good idea to ask someone brave or stupid enough who has already done it? Then here we are to tell you our story of transformation from Java backend devs to Kotlin backend developers.

We will tell you what pitfalls we see in Kotlin and which of its features we appreciate the most. We will walk you through the recipes we gathered in our last project. Last but not least we will tell you if we would choose Kotlin again, knowing what we know today :)

speaker: Paweł Pyzik
title: Kraków Kotlin User Group
subject: Can your team benefit from migrating to Kotlin?
description: After talk we would like to invite to you to discussion about benefits and drawback of switching from java to Kotlin. We will share stories from people who managed to convince their product owners to taka a risk of shifting to Kotlin.:)

speaker: Simon Wirtz
title: Kotlin User Group Düsseldorf
subject: Coroutines - Simple Concurrency with Kotlin
description:
This talk will give an overview of Kotlin's approach to coroutines and how they help you structure your code. Let's see what coroutines are, how they look like and how they support us in writing concurrent code for the JVM, JavaScript and other platforms.

It has never been a better time to get started with Kotlin coroutines as JetBrains has just released them in a 1.0 version.

speaker: Marcin Moskala
title: Kotlin Warsaw by Kt. Academy
subject: Klub dyskusji programistycznej
description: Spotkanie w czasie którego będziemy dyskutować na tematy związane z programowaniem. Głównym celem jest rozwój własnego zrozumienia problemów i koncepcji programistycznych, oraz wypracowywanie lepszych praktyk dla programistów. Dodatkowo chcemy poprawić nasze umiejętności sprawnego artykuowania swoich myśli oraz prowadzenia dyskusji programistycznej.

speaker: Ilmir Usmanov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Kotlin Coroutines: Deep Dive
description: Ильмир расскажет о том, как корутины устроены внутри: какие преобразования делает компилятор, чтобы синхронный код превратить в ассинхронный; как на низком уровне представлены корутины и что на самом деле делают функции suspendCoroutine и resume.

speaker: Ruslan Ibragimov
title: Belarus Kotlin User Group
subject: Undertow
description: Руслан расскажет о своем опыте использования Undertow: примеры использования, как подружить корутины с undertow и сравнит его с более известными Spring и Ktor.

speaker: Raul Raja
title: Chicago Kotlin Users Group
subject: Type Proofs and FP for the Kotlin Type System
description:
Type Proofs is a new compiler plugin built on Arrow Meta enabling new features in the Kotlin type system, such as Type Classes, Union Types, Type Refinements, and many other extensions that make Functional Programming easier in Kotlin.

Type Proofs propositions are expressed as extension functions that unlock new relationships between types ad-hoc whilst remaining fully compatible with subtype polymorphism and the existing inheritance type system.

This talk demonstrates some of the new features the Arrow team is introducing in Arrow at the type level and IDE and how others can benefit from them when buildinding libraries and applications.

speaker: Vladimír Valouch
title: Prague Mobile Development Meetup
subject: AppPort Academy for Kotlin vol. I
description: – Intellij setup & Basic Syntax + Basic Types – Control flow – Interface, Abstract Class – Conventions & Collections – Properties & Builders – Basic IO operations – Coroutines – Kotlin HTTP server creation with Ktor – Client Kotlin Ktor – Kotlin multiplatform setup Xcode + Android studio – Kotlin multiplatform client creation#

speaker: Filip Babić
title: GDG Zagreb
subject: Kotlin Flow
description: The latest Kotlin streaming framework by JetBrains.

speaker: Ian Shaun Thomas
title: GDG Zagreb
subject: Kodein
description: KodeinDI - a Kotlin multiplatform dependency retrieval library that will change the way you look at Dagger.

speaker: Francesco Vasco
title: Java/JVM User Group Torino
subject: Effective Java ≈ Kotlin
description:
Nel 2001 Joshua Bloch pubblica 'Effective Java', un compendio di buone pratiche di programmazione per Java.

Bloch spiega come risolvere in Java i 'problemi di tutti i giorni' e ispira Andrey Breslav nello sviluppo di Kotlin.

Discuteremo alcuni punti del libro e scopriremo come questi si applicano nei due linguaggi. Sono richieste conoscenze base del linguaggio Java.

speaker: Angélica Oliveira
title: Kotlin Meetup São Paulo
subject: Sequence x Iterable em Kotlin: Comparação de performance com Jetpack Benchmark

speaker: Wellington Costa
title: Kotlin Meetup São Paulo
subject: Kotlin Multiplatforma: Compartilhando código entre Android e iOS

speaker: Patrick Bashizi
title: GDG Kinshasa
subject: Android : Refactoring to Kotlin
description:
In this codelab, you'll learn how to refactor your code from Java to Kotlin. You'll also learn what the Kotlin language conventions are and how to ensure that the code you're writing follows them.

This codelab is suited to any developer that uses Java who is considering migrating their project to Kotlin. We'll start with a couple of Java classes that you'll convert to Kotlin using the IDE. Then we'll take a look at the converted code and see how we can improve it by making it more idiomatic and avoid common pitfalls.

speaker: Kubra Harmankaya
title: GDG Cloud London
subject: [Placeholder for the future] Remote Kotlin meetup
description: Kubra gave Kotlin/Everywhere talks. She will talking about her K/E journey and how to start converting a Java project to Kotlin.

speaker: Martin Schwitalla, Damian Lippok
title: Zalando Tech Events Dortmund
subject: find out how we utilize Kotlin for implementing microservices
description: Kotlin is mostly known as the go-to language for Android development. But it is also great as a more convenient alternative to Java for developing backend services. We at Zalando use Kotlin in both environments and our team has been developing Kotlin backend services at the core of our platform for more than 2 years now.

speaker: Martin Schwitalla, Damian Lippok
title: Prague Mobile Development Meetup
subject: AppPort Academy for Kotlin vol. I
description: Intellij setup & Basic Syntax + Basic Types – Control flow – Interface, Abstract Class – Conventions & Collections – Properties & Builders – Basic IO operations – Coroutines – Kotlin HTTP server creation with Ktor – Client Kotlin Ktor – Kotlin multiplatform setup Xcode + Android studio – Kotlin multiplatform client creation#

speaker: Hardik Trivedi
title: Kotlin London
subject: Introduction to Kotlin Flow
description: After the concept of coroutine where you can perform anything off the main thread, Kotlin has introduced yet another cool concept called Flow. Flow allows you to manage your data stream asynchronously. This talk aims to cover how Flow can be used for your android application. (But the concept can be applied for any Kotlin codebase) Following will be the key takeaways 1. Creating and cancelling the Flow 2. Various flow operators 3. Handling errors and exceptions 4. How I use flow for my projects 5. Testing your flow 6. High-level comparison with RxJava

speaker: Sebastian Aigner
title: Kotlin London
subject: Unleashing more Kotlin power – in full-stack web applications
description:
In this talk, we will explore how Kotlin and its features around multiplatform projects can help tackle tasks around writing systems that are distributed across multiple platforms, such as server-client applications. In particular, we will look at how Kotlin for JVM and Kotlin/JS can play together, allowing us to share models, business logic, and most of all knowledge. We will get a broad overview of creating, managing and building such applications – all from within a single Gradle project, staying type-safe, and utilizing common and platform libraries.

We'll also briefly talk about how we at JetBrains employ these Kotlin multiplatform features to prototype new ideas and realize products – from hackathon projects to JetBrains Space, our integrated team environment

speaker: Armando Picón
title: GDG Guatemala
subject: Coroutines in the way! Una plática sobre Kotlin Coroutines
description:
La programación asincrónica es muy importante. Ya sea que estemos creando aplicaciones del lado del servidor, de escritorio o móviles, es importante que brindemos una experiencia que no solo sea fluida desde la perspectiva del usuario, sino que sea escalable cuando sea necesario.

Existen muchos enfoques para este problema, y Kotlin toma uno muy flexible al proporcionar soporte de Corutinas a nivel de lenguaje y delegar la mayor parte de la funcionalidad a las bibliotecas, en línea con la filosofía de Kotlin.

speaker: Itolima Esther
title: GDG Port Harcourt
subject: Introduction to Kotlin
description: The meeting will be a hands coding session focused on teaching participants the basics of Kotlin and also answering related questions.

speaker: Manuel Ernesto
title: GDG Lubango
subject: [Online] Entendendo Kotlin Coroutines
description: Neste evento online, vamos nos familiarizar com o conceito de Kotlin Coroutines e ver as melhores e boas práticas da utilização do mesmo em projectos Android e não só.

speaker: Raul Raja
title: Kraków Kotlin User Group
subject: Type Proofs and Functional Programming for the Kotlin Type System

speaker: Georgios Andrianakis
title: Kotlin User Group Stuttgart
subject: An Introduction to Quarkus for Kotlin Developers
description: This talk will introduce developers to Quarkus, Red Hat's Container First Cloud Native Java framework and show how it can be used with Kotlin.

speaker: Jigar Brahmbhatt
title: GDG Boston Android
subject: Kotlin tips and tricks
description: In this talk, you'll learn about various Kotlin related topics including: - Building Kotlin based Android SDKs - Kotlin's collection mutability - Writing more Kotlinish code compared to writing Kotlin code in Javaish way - And more!

speaker: Jakub Jabłoński
title: Kotlin User Group Berlin
subject: Informal get-together of Kotlin developers in Berlin

speaker: Christophe Beyls
title: GDG Brussels
subject: Kotlin: From Java to Kotlin, a study of a conference app migration
description: - How Data classes and Parcelize remove a lot of boilerplate code in the model classes - How immutability and null safety have been enforced in the code with minimal efforts - How KTX makes Android framework and Jetpack APIs more Kotlin-friendly - Coroutines integration at different levels in the app.

speaker: Cedric Ravalec
title: Kotlin Paris Meetup
subject: GraphQL : implémentation en Kotlin vers une architecture microservicielle !
description: GraphQL, crée par Facebook, puis rendu open-source, gagne de plus en plus de popularité dans le monde des API. Kotlin n'échappe donc pas au mouvement et propose des solutions permettant de créer un client ou bien un server Kotlin. Ici, nous présenterons une librairie d'expedia pour la partie Server et le client sera créé grâce à Apollo.

speaker: Enrique López-Mañas
title: Kotlin User Group Munich - KUG Munich
subject: Kotlin Meetup - June Edition
description: Have you been working on a project with Kotlin? Is there a library you would like to discuss? Would you like to try public speaking or need help to prepare a talk? Message us, come and have fun sharing your Kotlin story!

speaker: Vinicius Vendramini
title: Kotlin Meetup São Paulo
subject: Convertendo Swift para Kotlin com Gryphon

speaker: Jakub Jabłoński
title: Virtual Kotlin User Group
subject: KFSM - A Kotlin DSL for Finite State Machine
description: KFSM is an open-source project that provides a multiplatform Kotlin FSM implementation configured using a DSL. This talk will revisit the history of FSMs and provide insight in the specific implementation and we will live code a sample based on the audience platform choice.

speaker: Rivu Chakraborty
title: Kotlin Community Mumbai
subject: Test-Driven Development in Android Using Spek Framework
description: Join us this month with our special guest Rivu Chakraborty to learn about Spek a Kotlin Based Specification Testing framework for the JVM.

speaker: Viktor Penelski
title: GDG Sofia
subject: Practical Concurrency - a Kotlin coroutines hands-on
description:
Concurrency is hard. Let's check out together how Kotlin attempts to tackle that in a practical way using their take on lightweight threads - the coroutines.

Together, we'll follow a hands-on exercise, learning about: - suspend functions - using coroutines for concurrency - sharing data between coroutines using channels

speaker: Juan Guillermo Gómez
title: Kotlin User Group Medellin
subject: Eliminando boilerplate en Kotlin gracias al Procesador de Anotaciones
description: Existen situaciones donde tenemos código que se repite varias veces en diferentes lugares; esto lo podemos solucionar centralizando el código en un helper o con otra estrategia diferente. Sin embargo a veces ese código debe ser generado dependiendo de unas entradas. Para ello podemos usar el procesador de anotaciones, que por medio de metadatos (anotaciones) generamos código en tiempo de compilación. En esta charla, veremos cómo funciona el procesador de anotaciones, sus ventajas, desventajas y crearemos anotaciones para unos casos de uso.

speaker: Garth Gilmour
title: Kotlin London
subject: Generics on the JVM: What you don't know will hurt you
description:
Generics on the JVM is hard. You don't need to look far to find evidence of this, but a good start would be (the 350 page FAQ)[http://www.angelikalanger.com/GenericsFAQ/JavaGenericsFAQ.html]. Issues with Generics trace back to three root causes. First, the inherent difficulty combining type parameters with sub-typing, second the compromises made in the Java syntax and finally the decision to go for a non-reified implementation.

Kotlin does its best to mitigate these problems. For example, declaration-site variance and type projections are used instead of wildcard types, and reification is supported for type parameters of inline functions. When combined with IDE support this makes generic coding less fraught and much more productive.

speaker: Matt Moore, Nicolás D'Cotta
title: Kotlin London
subject: Adding pattern matching to Kotlin
description:
One of the reasons Kotlin has proven so popular is its wide array of abstractions and constructs. But pattern matching, a popular feature that in other languages allows us to easily inspect data and act accordingly, is currently missing.

This talk aims to explore the possibility of adding pattern matching to Kotlin. It will go through why and how it could be done, from adding it to the actual language to using a compiler plugin (much like kotlinx.serialization works).

speaker: Kesego Tumisang
title: GDG Gaborone
subject: Kotlin Night Gaborone
description: • What we'll do GDG Gaborone would like to invite you to this year's Kotlin Night, where we will be talking about Kotlin programming language and how it can be used to build Android applications. There will be T-shirt giveaways and laptop stickers • What to bring Laptop with Android Studio 3.5 or IDEA IntelliJ 2019.3 installed, Stress ball, Water bottle and a coding Buddy

speaker: Ángel Hernandez
title: KeepCoding
subject: Componentes de Arquitectura
